tweets.text: A barren spring on the River Lugg canal. Other picture is the #riverlugg on the other side of Kingsland bridge. Are you still there @EnvAgency  @DaveThroupEA @NaturalEngland ?? https://t.co/Yu6A3Cio1w

@EnvAgency visiting #WalleysQuarry during the day is a start but the daytime odour is only the tip of the stinky iceberg. It's exponentially worse at night and I've come to dread sunset as that's when the landfill gas fills the house @PHE_uk #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe @bbchealth

@StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @PHE_uk I'd like to register case of torture with United Nations, no one should have to suffer this sleep deprivation, haul them responsible before the international courts & treat us like the victims we are #StopTheStink

urls.title: New major study shows importance of nature in hitting net zero
urls.description: Natural England study reviews carbon storage impact from England‚Äôs habitats, including native woodlands, saltmarshes, grasslands, heathlands and peatlands.

tweets.text:

A new study shows the power of different habitats to remove and lock up carbon - helping us to hit our net zero target by 2050. ‚¨áÔ∏è

Our pension fund is committing to reach net zero by 2045 and halve emissions by 2030 through the companies it invests in.

urls.title: The Environment Agency Pension Fund goes net zero
urls.description: The Environment Agency‚Äôs ¬£4 billion Pension Fund has committed to reach net zero by 2045 and halve emissions by 2030. This commitment is part of its ongoing work to significantly reduce the emissions from the 2,000 companies that the Fund invests in, directly supporting the UK‚Äôs Green Finance Strategy and the UK‚Äôs plans for COP26.

Hi @EnvAgencyAnglia any chance you can collect your diesel soaked rubbish from UEA? It‚Äôs been there since Jan and I‚Äôve asked you to collect privately several times. There is still pollution of the river.Diesel is leaking from this rubbish and I had to re-seal the bags. #littering https://t.co/gp5rJPjFGK

I don't live close enough to the dump to smell it, but Newcastle-u-L's @StinkStopthe campaign highlights the serious flaws in UK environment regulation, and the toothlessness of an underfunded and underpowered Environment Agency. https://t.co/Hfu0RzlO0a

Experts have warned that the full extent of pollution discharged into England‚Äôs waterways over 2020 will never be known due to a dramatic decline in the number of tests carried out by the Environment Agency during the pandemic.
https://t.co/Sr1YmIvr5s

urls.title: Making it easier to find registered waste carriers
urls.description: Nick Brenchley, National Lead for Metadata and Data Sharing Systems, discusses the EA's new waste 'widget' to help customers find registered waste carriers.¬†

tweets.text:
We're using technology to support waste carriers.

We‚Äôve developed a new online tool that makes it easier for customers to check if a waste carrier is registered with us.

Find out more here: https://t.co/l4EG6rV1DW

@pmorganbentley could you investigate the huge failings of the @EnvAgency  in regards to #walleysquarry? Residents are subjected to toxic amounts of H2S. This is an emergency. People are ill. We are being failed. Please help.

#stopthestink
